trans-unit.source: Provides a glyph for an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> to display when a user has not performed required designer actions at design time.
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] Activity designers use ConfigErrorGlyph to display actions associated with smart tags on the designer surface.
For example, if an activity requires users to set a property, the activity designer displays ConfigErrorGlyph to help notify them that they are required to set the property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConfigErrorGlyph"></xref> class.

Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConfigErrorGlyph"></xref> can gain focus on the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> with which it is associated.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the designer glyph can be activated; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Returns the bounds for the glyph on the specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> with which the glyph is associated.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate whether the glyph appears on the activity designer surface; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the bounds for the glyph.
designer contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Notifies the glyph that an action has been performed which has activated the glyph.
When OnActivate is called, the designer verbs associated with the glyph are displayed on the activity designer surface.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> on which the glyph is drawn.
Performs any tasks required to render the glyph on the activity designer surface.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> to perform fill and drawing tasks.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the glyph appears on the design surface; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme"></xref> to use to access ambient property settings.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> from which to obtain information about user actions.
Gets the priority setting for the glyph on the activity designer surface.
An integer value that represents the priority setting for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConfigErrorGlyph"></xref> on the activity design surface.
